excerpt: Contemporary Buddhist temple drawing massive crowds with its unique, intricate white exterior.
detail_description: Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, is a contemporary Buddhist temple located in Chiang Rai, Thailand. Designed by artist Chalermchai Kositpipat, it features a unique white exterior with intricate designs and unconventional architecture. Inside, visitors can explore unusual murals and decorations along with odd sculptures. The temple aims to provide a space for learning and meditation to promote the teachings of Buddhism.
name: Wat Rong Khun
address: Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Compact night market offering street food, apparel, jewelry & gifts, plus live entertainment.
detail_description: Chiang Rai Night Bazaar is a bustling and compact night market that offers a variety of experiences. Visitors can explore street food stalls, shop for apparel, jewelry, and gifts, and enjoy live entertainment. The market is located near the ancient temple in Mueang Chiang Rai district, which holds historical significance in the province. It features the prominent Emerald Buddha and other magnificent Buddha statues. Additionally, the area around Jedyod road offers backpacker bars and affordable dining options.
name: Chiang Rai Night Bazaar
address: WR4M+5M2, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: A collection of wood buildings featuring works by Thawan Duchanee & other contemporary Thai artists.
detail_description: Baan Dam Museum, also known as the Black House, is a unique collection of wood buildings showcasing the artworks of Thawan Duchanee and other contemporary Thai artists. Situated in Chiang Rai, it is part of a day tour that includes visits to prominent temples such as the White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and the Blue Temple (Wat Rong Sueur Ten). The museum offers an intriguing experience with its dark-themed architecture and displays.
name: Baan Dam Museum
address: 333, Nang Lae, อำเภอเมือง, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Elaborate golden clock tower in the center of a traffic circle, with colorful lights at night.
detail_description: The Chiang Rai Clock Tower is a stunning architectural masterpiece located in the heart of a traffic circle. Designed by renowned artist and architect Chalermchai Kositpipat, it bears resemblance to the iconic White Temple with its distinctive style. At night, the tower comes alive with colorful lights, creating a surreal environment.
name: Chiang Rai Clock Tower
address: WR4J+V94 สุขสถิต, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Monumental, modern Buddhist temple distinguished by its vivid blue coloring & elaborate carvings.
detail_description: Wat Rong Suea Ten, also known as the Blue Temple, is a modern Buddhist temple in Chiang Rai. It stands out with its striking sapphire blue exterior and intricate golden detailing. Visitors can explore this monumental temple as part of a day tour that includes other prominent temples such as the White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and the Black House (Baandam Museum).
name: Rong Suea Ten Temple
address: 306 หมู่ที่ 2 Maekok Rd, Tambon Rim Kok, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Temple complex featuring a 9-floor pagoda with 12 surrounding structures & a giant Buddha.
detail_description: Wat Huay Pla Kang is a temple complex located 6 km northwest of Chiang Rai city. It features a 9-floor pagoda with 12 surrounding structures and a giant statue of the bodhisattva Guan Yin, also known as the Goddess of Mercy. Despite being called 'Big Buddha,' it's not actually a Buddha statue. Visitors can climb to the highest level of the pagoda for stunning views over Chiang Rai by either using stairs or paying for an elevator ride.
name: วัดห้วยปลากั้ง
address: 553, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Contemporary Buddhist temple drawing massive crowds with its unique, intricate white exterior.
detail_description: Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, is a unique and spectacular attraction in North Thailand. It serves as both a temple and an art gallery, featuring contemporary murals that offer thought-provoking scenes related to life, death, and human suffering. While the entrance fee is 100 baht, many visitors find it worth the price for the amazing experience. The temple's appearance surpasses its pictures and is considered a must-visit tourist spot.
name: Wat Rong Khun
address: Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: If you find yourself near the renowned Golden Triangle in Thailand's Chiang Rai province, make sure to visit Raan Paa On Restaurant. Situated right beside the Mekong River, this eatery offers delectable local Thai cuisine that is sure to tantalize your taste buds. Additionally, located at the heart of Chiang Rai, it provides excellent value for money and exceptional hospitality.
name: Golden Triangle Palace Hotel
address: A, 590 Phaholyothin Road T. Wiang A. Mueang Chiang Rai T, Wiang, 57000, Thailand

excerpt: 14th-century temple housing a copy of Thailand's revered Emerald Buddha, discovered here in 1434.
detail_description: Wat Phra Kaew Chiang Rai, a 14th-century temple located in Mueang Chiang Rai district, is home to the revered Emerald Buddha, discovered on the temple grounds in 1434. Originally known as Wat Pa Ya or Wat Pa Yia, it was renamed in 1977 after the discovery of the Emerald Buddha image. The temple features a multi-faced ubosot built in 2433 and has undergone restoration over time.
name: วัดพระแก้ว
address: 19 หมู่ที่ 1 Trairat Rd, Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Unique museum exhibiting Northern Thailand's tribal history with jewelry, costumes & sculptures.
detail_description: Oub Kham Museum is a unique destination that showcases the rich tribal history of Northern Thailand. While it may not be as well-known as other cultural sites, this museum provides an in-depth look at the thousand-year history of the Tai people and Lanna culture. The private collections on display include ancient artifacts, textiles, Buddha images, and everyday items from Julasak Suriyachai's family, who has royal lineage in Lanna.
name: Oub Kham Museum
address: 81/1 Nahkhai Rd, Tambon Rop Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Bucolic park featuring stunning landscaped gardens, museums & a traditional Lanna pavilion.
detail_description: Nestled just a few kilometers from the heart of Chiang Rai, Mae Fah Luang Art and Cultural Park is a serene oasis that beautifully blends nature with cultural heritage. This picturesque park boasts meticulously landscaped gardens, vibrant flowers, and tranquil ponds, making it an ideal spot for leisurely strolls. Visitors can explore the rich history of the Lanna culture through its impressive collection of artifacts housed in various museums within the park. The site also features traditional Buddhist temples that add to its charm.
name: Mae Fah Luang Art and Cultural Park (Rai Mae Fah Luang)
address: 313 หมู่ที่ 7 บ้าน, Pa Ngew, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Museum & cultural center focused on the area's 6 hill tribes, with costumes, tools & more artifacts.
detail_description: The Hilltribe Museum and Education Centre in Chiang Rai is a cultural center dedicated to the six hill tribes of Northern Thailand: Akha, Hmong, Karen, Lahu, Lisu, and Yao. It offers an insightful look into the history and heritage of the region's Lanna culture through its extensive collection of artifacts such as traditional costumes, tools, carvings, and cooking utensils.
name: Hilltribe Museum
address: อาคารสมาคมพัฒนาประชากรและชุมชน, Thanalai, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Venerated statue of Chiang Rai's founder on a pedestal surrounded by white horses & elephants.
detail_description: The King Mangrai Monument in Chiang Rai is a revered statue of the city's founder, King Mengrai, standing on a pedestal surrounded by white horses and elephants. Built in 1262, Chiang Rai was the original capital of the Lanna kingdom before being replaced by Chiang Mai. The monument symbolizes reverence for King Mengrai and his significant role in establishing the city. Visitors can learn about free sightseeing tram tours at an information kiosk behind the monument.
name: King Mangrai Monument
address: WR6R+536, ถนน ห้าแยก, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Chiang Rai River Beach, also known as the Little Pattaya of Chiang Rai, is a hidden gem located along the picturesque Kok River, just a short distance from Chiang Rai city. This 1,200-meter stretch of sandy riverbank offers a tranquil escape and is popular among locals for swimming and relaxation. Surrounded by bamboo huts, visitors can savor traditional Thai cuisine and cold drinks before or after taking a refreshing dip in the river.
name: Chiang Rai River Beach
address: WQ9V+3FW, Rop Wiang Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: On Saturday nights, Chiang Rai comes alive with the vibrant 'Saturday Night Market' on Thanalai Road. This bustling walking street is lined with an array of food stalls offering delicious Thai snacks. The market stretches from Thipanet Road to the ancient gate of Chiang Mai, making it easy to navigate. Visitors can explore a variety of stalls selling handicrafts and indulge in mouth-watering street food.
name: Saturday Night Market
address: WR5J+F86 สุขสถิต, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Street-food stands & stalls selling wooden carvings & batik clothing at a busy market.
detail_description: Walking Street Chiang Rai is a bustling market offering a wide range of experiences for visitors. From street-food stands to wooden carvings and batik clothing, the market is filled with options. In addition to shopping and dining, the street also features Thai spas, handcrafted products, folk concerts, and Thai dance shows. Local performers entertain on a mini stage while art and craft stalls showcase their wares.
name: Chiang Rai Walking Street
address: Thanalai, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: If you find yourself exploring the stunning Blue Temple in Chiang Rai, make sure to stop by the delightful ice cream shop nearby. This charming spot offers a unique coconut ice cream served in a coconut shell, beautifully complemented by butterfly pea juice that adds both flavor and visual appeal. The vibrant blue hue of the ice cream is not only Instagram-worthy but also incredibly refreshing on a hot day. With its fragrant taste and friendly service, this treat is an absolute must-try during your visit to the area.
name: Ice cream shop besides Blue temple
address: 303 Maekok Rd, Rim Kok, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Chiang Rai is a city in northern Thailand, in the mountainous province of the same name. They city is near the borders of Laos and Myanmar (formerly Burma). Wat Phra Kaew is a royal temple that once housed the jade Emerald Buddha and now displays a replica. Nearby, the Navel City Pillar is a monument made of more than 100 Khmer-style pillars. Mae Fah Luang Art and Cultural Park is a museum showcasing Lanna artifacts.
detail_description: Mueang Chiang Rai, located in the mountainous province of the same name in northern Thailand, is a captivating destination near the borders of Laos and Myanmar. The city boasts unique architectural wonders such as Wat Phra Kaew and the Navel City Pillar, offering a glimpse into its rich history and culture. Visitors can explore the Mae Fah Luang Art and Cultural Park to discover Lanna artifacts.
name: Mueang Chiang Rai
address: Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai, Thailand

excerpt: Relaxed riverside outfit with a garden prepping international fare made from seasonal ingredients.
detail_description: Chivit Thamma Da Coffee House, Bistro & Bar is a charming family-owned establishment situated along the picturesque Kok River in Chiang Rai, Thailand. This cozy spot offers a delectable array of dishes crafted from locally sourced ingredients, providing a delightful taste of northern Thai cuisine while also supporting the local community. The menu boasts an enticing mix of traditional Thai and European fare, catering to diverse palates. Additionally, visitors can indulge in an assortment of delectable cakes from the bakery.
name: Chivit Thamma Da Coffee House, Bistro & Bar
address: หมู่ที่ 2, 179, Bannrongseartean Soi 3, Mueang Chiang Rai District, 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Outdoor hot-springs attraction offering soaking pools & add-on treatments such as massage.
detail_description: Pong Phrabat Hot Springs is a perfect destination for those seeking relaxation and natural beauty. The outdoor attraction features hot springs that feed into man-made pools, offering visitors a chance to soak in the warm waters while surrounded by nature. For the more adventurous, there's a nearby waterfall to hike to before indulging in the hot springs. Couples can also find it an ideal getaway, with private rooms available for a more intimate experience. Additionally, add-on treatments such as massages are offered on-site.
name: Pong Phrabat Hot Springs
address: 486 หมู่ 6, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: This historic Buddhist temple with a golden pagoda is known for containing relics of the Buddha.
detail_description: Wat Phra That Doi Chom Thong is a historic Buddhist temple in Chiang Rai, Thailand, featuring a golden pagoda that houses relics of the Buddha. The temple is part of the rich cultural and natural landscape of Chiang Rai, which includes landmarks like Wat Phra Kaeo and Wat Ming Mueang Temple, as well as parks such as Phu Chi Fa Forest Park and Singha Park.
name: Wat Phra That Doi Chom Thong
address: WR8F+72M, ArjAmnuay Rd, Rop Wiang Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: The Art Bridge Gallery contains paintings, sculptures, scriptures, and other art objects. It is home to both Thai and international artists. The gallery is open all year round and has free admission. The souvenir shop and restaurant are located nearby.
name: Art Bridge
address: Phahonyothin Rd, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

excerpt: Well-known Buddhist temple with ornate details featuring both historical & 20th century sections.
detail_description: Wat Klang Wiang is a stunning Buddhist temple located in the heart of Chiang Rai. It is renowned for its intricate and ornate design, featuring both historical and 20th-century sections. The vihara, built in traditional Northern Thai style, underwent partial renovation after sustaining damage in 1903. Despite being less well-known than other temples in the area, Wat Klang Wiang stands out for its rich decorations and beautiful architecture.
name: Wat Klang Wiang
address: วัดกลางเวียง Wat Klang Wiang Chiang Rai ถนน, Uttarakit, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

name: Lalitta Café
address: 392, 6, Rim Kok, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

name: White Temple Workshop
address: RQC7+Q37, Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: When visiting Northern Thailand, make sure to include a tour trekking sightseeing adventure in your itinerary. With trusted tours holding TAT licenses, you can explore the region with knowledgeable guides or venture out on your own. Transportation options such as car and motorbike rentals are available, along with convenient hotel pickups and airport transfers for a hassle-free experience.
name: Tour Trekking Sightseeing
address: WR4J+9R4, Phisit Sa Nguan Alley, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Tribal village whose women wear stacked brass rings on their necks & sell handmade crafts.
detail_description: The Long Neck Karen Village, located in Chiang Mai, is a unique destination where visitors can immerse themselves in the culture and traditions of various tribes. The village is home to different tribes such as the Meo people with their stilt houses, the Palongs known for tea, and the Karen people who are skilled weavers. One of the main attractions is observing the Karen women wearing metal bracelets around their necks, legs, and forearms.
name: Long Neck Karen Village
address: 26 2VCV+P9G, Nang Lae, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

detail_description: Kad Luang Chiang Rai Market, also known as the Grand Market or the Big Wet Market, is a lively and vibrant destination that provides an authentic glimpse into local life in Chiang Rai. Situated in the heart of the city, this market offers a sensory experience for visitors, especially those who love street food. During the day, it's a bustling commercial hub with a wide array of goods including toys, clothing, accessories, and fresh produce.
name: Kad Luang Chiang Rai Market
address: 331, 4 Trairat Rd, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Mae Fah Luang - Chiang Rai International Airport (CEI) is a small but efficient airport located just 10 minutes from the city center by car. The check-in hall offers various food and coffee stalls, while the departure hall has a few options. The airport provides clean facilities, including toilets, and features a food court on the second floor along with several restaurant chains and local souvenir shops.
name: Mae Fah Luang - Chiang Rai International Airport
address: 404 หมู่ที่ 10 Phahonyothin Rd, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

detail_description: Wat Jed Yod is a serene and untouristed temple located in the heart of Chiang Rai, near the Golden Clock Tower. The main attraction is a large golden Buddha statue inside the main building, which exudes tranquility and relaxation. The exterior of the temple features intricate sculpted figures, reminiscent of the Mahabodhi Temple at Bodhgaya in India. Despite some missing components, visitors can still admire detailed figures on the exterior.
name: Wat Jed Yod
address: WR3J+9J5, Jetyod Rd, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Small, intricately decorated Buddhist temple built in the 13th century.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Chiang Rai, Wat Mung Muang is a hidden gem that beautifully showcases the rich history and architectural splendor of Thailand. Established in 1262 by Queen Maha Thewi Usa Payako, this temple stands as a testament to the Lanna Kingdom's heritage. While it may not be as renowned as other temples in the area, its intricate designs and unique elephant motifs set it apart from typical Thai structures adorned with nagas.
name: Wat Mung Muang
address: 2415 Ruangnakron Rd, Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Four Stars is a charming restaurant located in the heart of town, making it a convenient stop for visitors. The family-run establishment offers a limited but delectable menu, featuring dishes like nam ngiao and khao soi. The friendly staff, who speak excellent English, provide attentive service and generous portions at reasonable prices. The clean and tidy interior adds to the inviting atmosphere.
name: Four stars ร้านโฟร์สตาร์
address: 423/3 Banpapragarn Road, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Cat Bar is the perfect place to unwind after a long day, offering a laid-back atmosphere and nightly jam sessions featuring live performances. The bar serves a wide range of alcoholic beverages and snacks, and also provides a pool table for entertainment. Located in Chiang Rai, it's known for its relaxed vibe and is popular among locals and tourists alike. Additionally, it offers a great view of the town from its cozy rooftop setting.
name: Cat Bar
address: เวียง, 528/24, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Doy Din Dang Pottery เครื่องปั้นดินเผาดอยดินแดง is a pottery studio and gallery located on the outskirts of Chiang Rai, Thailand. The renowned Thai potter, Somluk Pantiboon, combines his international training with a local touch to create practical and decorative ceramics using natural glazes made from rice, bamboo, ash, and wood.
name: Doy Din Dang Pottery เครื่องปั้นดินเผาดอยดินแดง
address: 2V8J+WRX, Nang Lae, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

detail_description: Pong Phra Bat Waterfall, located in Lam Nam Kok National Park, offers a serene natural retreat with its pools and cascading stream. Tucked away at the end of a road near Rajabhat University, it's an ideal spot for picnics and immersing oneself in untouched nature. The area is teeming with wildlife like birds, butterflies, and wildflowers.
name: Pong Phra Bat Water Fall
address: Highway 1511 , Ban Du , 57100 Mueang Chiang Rai , Chiang Rai, Thailand

detail_description: Nestled on the banks of the Kok River, Wat Tham Phra (Buddha Cave Temple) offers a serene escape from city life. Visitors can observe wild macaque monkeys playing and swinging from trees, as well as bathing in the turquoise lake alongside catfish. The temple's interior is located within a cave where bats frolic, and lucky visitors may witness monks praying. A steep staircase leads to the cave inside the mountain and a viewpoint offering stunning panoramic views of the area.
name: Wat Tham Phra (Buddha Cave Temple)
address: 404 Sankhongluang Soi 7, Rop Wiang Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Stay In Hostel สเตย์อินโฮสเทล is a top choice for backpackers in Chiang Rai. The owner is known for being incredibly helpful and accommodating, even going the extra mile to prepare breakfast early for guests with early departures. The hostel offers clean and comfortable rooms, some with balconies, as well as a lounge area with books and board games.
name: Stay In Hostel
address: 139/25 สันโค้งน้อย, รอบเวียง เมือง, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Khao Soi Restaurant is a must-visit if you find yourself in Northern Thailand. This popular dish, synonymous with the region, features soft egg noodles topped with a creamy coconut-based curry and crispy egg noodles. It's often served with pickled greens, limes, and shallots for added flavor. While variations of Khao Soi can be found throughout the area, it typically includes mild coconut-based curry poured over soft egg noodles and enjoyed with crispy egg noodles.
name: Khao Soi Restaurant
address: Prasopsook Rd, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: If you find yourself exploring the vibrant city of Chiang Rai, make sure to swing by Betty Coffee for a refreshing iced drink. This charming spot is not only budget-friendly, with lattes priced at just 25 baht, but it also boasts a quirky ambiance filled with Betty Boop memorabilia that fans will adore. While the coffee may not be the finest in town, it's complemented by delightful Italian sodas and a selection of Thai tea that many patrons enjoy.
name: Betty Coffee
address: WR6M+45W, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: The Sunday Night Market in Chiang Rai, located on Phaholyothin Road, is a captivating and vibrant attraction that offers a delightful array of experiences for visitors. While slightly smaller than the Saturday market, it tends to be less crowded, making it more appealing for those who want to avoid large crowds. The market mainly focuses on food stalls offering delicious Thai cuisine and provides an authentic local experience with cultural performances and games.
name: Sunday Night Market
address: WR29+HJJ, Sankhongnoi Rd, Tambon Rop Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Waterfall offers a serene and picturesque trek through lush jungle vegetation, with well-maintained trails by the national park. While the waterfall itself may not be grand, the journey to reach it is truly beautiful. The trail provides an opportunity to appreciate water as a vital source of life and enjoy a refreshing dip in its cool waters. Even in the dry season, the road to Waterfall remains pleasant, making for a delightful walk amidst large stones and dense jungle foliage.
name: Waterfall
address: 2R72+Q32, Unnamed Road, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

detail_description: The Volare Cycling Jersey is perfect for exploring the traditional charm of Chiang Rai, with its scenic country roads, quaint villages, and local temples. Whether you opt for a half-day or full-day cycling adventure, this smaller city offers a delightful experience. The jersey's excellent craftsmanship and top-notch service ensure a comfortable and enjoyable ride as you receive helpful advice from friendly locals along the way.
name: Volare Cycling Jersey
address: 53, 80 หมู่ 1, Tambon Rop Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Chiang Rai First Church is a unique sight in a city filled with Buddhist temples. It stands out as one of the oldest churches in Chiang Rai, boasting simple yet elegant architecture that incorporates plenty of wood. The church's design blends seamlessly with the surrounding cityscape. Established over 100 years ago by missionaries, it has become an integral part of the community and hosts lively services, including a vibrant Christmas Eve celebration complete with Thai translations of Christmas carols and a charming nativity play.
name: Chiang Rai First Church
address: 592 ม.3 Rattanakheat Rd, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: The Morning Market, located near Shin Sane Guest House, is a bustling and lively spot where locals and hill people gather to buy and sell various goods. From fresh fish, meat, vegetables, and fruits to clothing and other items, this market offers a wide array of products. While it may not be the typical tourist attraction, it provides an authentic glimpse into the daily life of Thai people. The unique aroma of fresh food fills the air as vendors set up their stalls in the morning and evening.
name: Morning Market
address: WR5H+RV3, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: Chiang Rai City tram is a free guided tour that takes you around the city's tourist attractions for about an hour and a half. The tram ride offers explanations in Thai, making it an informative experience. Visitors can explore various temples with unique architecture, such as Wat Phra Kaew, Wat Phra Singh, and Wat Klang Wiang. While the main attractions of Chiang Rai may lie outside the city limits, this tram tour provides an opportunity to discover hidden gems within the city itself.
name: Chiang Rai City tram
address: WR6Q+5VJ, Singhaclai Rd, Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

detail_description: NAN Sapling Farm is a charming and picturesque agricultural attraction located in the heart of nature. Visitors can immerse themselves in the serene surroundings while learning about sustainable farming practices and enjoying the fresh air. The farm offers a variety of activities such as picking fruits, exploring organic gardens, and experiencing the daily life of a farmer. It's an ideal destination for those seeking a peaceful retreat and an opportunity to connect with nature.
name: NAN ต้นอ่อนฟาร์ม
address: Wiang Chai, Wiang Chai District, Chiang Rai 57210, Thailand

detail_description: De Relax Massage, or เดอ รีแลกซ์ นวดเพื่อสุขภาพ, is a hidden gem in Chiang Rai that offers a variety of rejuvenating massage experiences. Visitors can indulge in an upper body massage that effectively targets tension and knots, providing relief after a long day. The foot massages are particularly noteworthy; they not only refresh tired legs but also include delightful head and neck treatments as an added bonus.
name: De Relax Massage เดอ รีแลกซ์ นวดเพื่อสุขภาพ
address: 869, 18 Phaholyothin Rd, Wiang, เมือง, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

excerpt: Overlooking a range of villages, this mountain features hiking trails with views of lush hillsides.
detail_description: Doi Mae Salong, located 74 km northwest of Chiang Rai city, offers picturesque and serene mountain views with lush hillsides and a range of interesting villages. The area is known for its Chinese immigrant community, which adds to the unique cultural experience. Visitors can explore tea plantations and enjoy the clean, green surroundings while tasting local teas or coffees at village restaurants. It's recommended to have Thai Baht on hand as there are no currency exchange services available in the area.
name: Doi Mae Salong
address: Mae Salong Nok, Mae Fa Luang District, Chiang Rai 57110, Thailand

excerpt: Waterfall with a shallow pool, accessible via a trail through bamboo trees & tropical vegetation.
detail_description: Khun Korn Forest Park Waterfall is a magical place nestled in the forest, offering a beautiful cascade after an easy 30-minute hike. Accessible via well-maintained roads, it's just a 35-minute motorbike ride from Chiang Rai. The park features lush trails and the refreshing waterfall, making it an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts to unwind.
name: Khun Korn Forest Park Waterfall
address: VJM8+4C4, หลวงหมายเลข 1208, Mae Kon, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

name: Tat Khwan Waterfall Forest Park
address: 258P+W6R, Tat Khwan, Phaya Mengrai District, Chiang Rai 57290, Thailand
